DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Protocol Deviations Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Sponsor Defined Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the protocol deviations domain to address eligibility criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Protocol Deviations Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)_Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the protocol deviations domain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)

A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the protocol deviations domain.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Inclusion Exclusion Criterion Category Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The body system or organ class that pertains to a medical history._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._The words or language units by which a thing is known._A classification of the inclusion exclusion criterion._An entity that is responsible for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study._Clearly characterized or delimited.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

Concepts.definition: A classification of the inclusion exclusion criterion.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
